sub_topic: Finding the determinant of a matrix
message_1:
Find the determinant of the following $3 \times 3$ matrix: 
$$\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{vmatrix}$$
message_2:
To find the determinant of a $3 \times 3$ matrix, we use the following formula:

$$\det(A) = a(ei - fh) - b(di - fg) + c(dh - eg)$$

where $A = \begin{pmatrix} a & b & c \\ d & e & f \\ g & h & i \end{pmatrix}$.

In this case, we have:

$$\det(A) = \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{vmatrix} = 1(5 \cdot 9 - 6 \cdot 8) - 2(4 \cdot 9 - 6 \cdot 7) + 3(4 \cdot 8 - 5 \cdot 7)$$

Now, we compute the values:

$$\det(A) = 1(45 - 48) - 2(36 - 42) + 3(32 - 35)$$

$$\det(A) = 1(-3) - 2(-6) + 3(-3)$$

$$\det(A) = -3 + 12 - 9$$

$$\det(A) = 0$$

So, the determinant of the given matrix is $0$.
